ygData.subject: Re: ghoulbane
ygData.msgSnippet: I wish there were lower level magical swords that were a little easier to obtain. Like in Dungeons and Dragons. The +1 Longsword was pretty common, but it
ygData.messageBody:
I wish there were lower level magical swords that were a little easier to
obtain. Like in Dungeons and Dragons. The +1 Longsword was pretty common,
but it could hit for magical damage. The closest thing to that is a Combine
Sword, which is still more expesive than most of us can afford. (armor, and
spells, they aren't free). Ok, so maybe a magicla Item isn't actually
needed, but how do I beat Ghoul? Im a paladin, its one of my most hated
enemies, yet I can't touch it. Fun. There needs to be balance, it is
something definatly lacking in the Everquest Universe.

-Dyce

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Dustin_Hicks@... [SMTP:Dustin_Hicks@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 11, 1999 3:16 PM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqpaladin] ghoulbane
>
> From: Dustin_Hicks@...
>
>
>
> A post I saw:
>
> I have the honor of personally knowing most of the group that retrieved
> the
> first Ghoulsbane.
> From rumors, you know that it is in Upper Guk, but now it is confirmed.
> Don't know the MOB that has it, but I do know from the size and level of
> the
> group that it is powerful.
> The group that attained it ranged from Levels 35 to 27. They may have had
> more than 1 group as well.
> Stats on the awesome Paladin only sword:
> 1H Slash 15DMG 34SPD, and casts Dismiss Undead.
> Imagine being able to double attack for a potential full 30DMG (about 70
> to
> 80HP with the level bonuses), and at a speed that is at least 10 to 13
> points faster than the Shiny Halberd, and Black Iron Sword.
> Also, they can now use a magic shield. The black shield that gives +9 STR
> comes to mind.
> Anyways, a final congrats, and no names are mentioned because of the flood
> and onslaught of tells and questions.
>
>
> Kaane
> Tarrew Marr
>
